algorithm_technique: Model as a bipartite graph problem and use Hopcroft-Karp for maximum matching.
problem_summary_simple: Minimize flips of 1s to 0s so no two 1s are adjacent horizontally or vertically.
problem_summary_technical: Construct a bipartite graph from adjacent 1s and find the maximum independent set via maximum matching.
time_complexity: O(E * sqrt(V)) which is O(m*n * sqrt(m*n))
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding the minimum number of vertices to remove to make the graph of adjacent 1s an independent set.
This is equivalent to finding the maximum independent set in the graph of adjacent 1s.
For bipartite graphs, the size of the maximum independent set is `|V| - |Maximum Matching|`.
